{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3691723,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-28T13:23:38.361Z","cooked":"

Is there any performance overhead issues with running a command continuously setting something like a motor controller to the same value and defaulting to a stop command or running it once and then letting the subsystem’s periodic method ( or even the motor controller) take over. Having an idle default with Triggers that handle setting and stopping in other words.

I would think constantly utilizing then CAN network by calling set on the motor controller would be worse.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-07-28T13:23:38.361Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":72.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504726,"topic_slug":"set-and-let-run-or-constantly-update-commandbased","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/set-and-let-run-or-constantly-update-commandbased/504726/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3691733,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-28T13:28:28.743Z","cooked":"

Sending a “set” call at 50Hz would be a pretty minimal load for the robot controller.

It is preferable to just set it once though, and stop it later when you need to, for the reasons you stated.

It could technically be safer to use the former approach, with WPILib motor safety enabled. Many times when using the latter approach, when re-enabling after an undesirable behavior, the motor “remembers” it’s last command and continues to execute that, as opposed to being stopped.

Sometimes its nice to give the subsystem periodic method something to do. handling repeatedly setting the state would make sent. Or having the command do it.

so like keeping track of the state (with like an enum) and if its’ stop then do a check in periodic and just keep applying stopMotor or something.

I always try to avoid sending motor calls if possible. If the state machine necessitates a change in motor behavior, then send that control request, if not, then don’t.
